com.io7m.jtensors

Class VectorI2L

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.io7m.jtensors.VectorI2L
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    VectorReadable2LType

    @Immutable
public final class VectorI2L
extends Object
implements VectorReadable2LType

    A two-dimensional immutable vector type with integer elements.

    Values of this type are immutable and can therefore be safely accessed from multiple threads.

    Since:
    5.3.0

                          throws ArithmeticException
        Calculate the absolute values of the elements in vector v.
        Parameters:
        v - The input vector
        Returns:
        (abs v.x, abs v.y, abs v.z)
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException - Iff an internal arithmetic operation causes an integer overflow
        Since:
        5.0.0

      • add

        public static VectorI2L add(VectorReadable2LType v0,
                            VectorReadable2LType v1)
                     throws ArithmeticException
        Calculate the element-wise sum of the vectors v0 and v1.
        Parameters:
        v0 - The left input vector
        v1 - The right input vector
        Returns:
        (v0.x + v1.x, v0.y + v1.y)
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException - Iff an internal arithmetic operation causes an integer overflow

      • addScaled

        public static VectorI2L addScaled(VectorReadable2LType v0,
                                  VectorReadable2LType v1,
                                  double r)
                           throws ArithmeticException
        Calculate the element-wise sum of the vectors v0 and the element-wise product of v1 and r.
        Parameters:
        v0 - The left input vector
        v1 - The right input vector
        r - The scaling value
        Returns:
        (v0.x + (v1.x * r), v0.y + (v1.y * r))
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException - Iff an internal arithmetic operation causes an integer overflow

      • clamp

        public static VectorI2L clamp(VectorReadable2LType v,
                              long minimum,
                              long maximum)
        Clamp the elements of the vector v to the range [minimum .. maximum] inclusive.
        Parameters:
        v - The input vector
        minimum - The minimum allowed value
        maximum - The maximum allowed value
        Returns:
        A vector with both elements equal to at most maximum and at least minimum
        Since:
        5.0.0

      • clampByVector

        public static VectorI2L clampByVector(VectorReadable2LType v,
                                      VectorReadable2LType minimum,
                                      VectorReadable2LType maximum)
        Clamp the elements of the vector v to the inclusive range given by the corresponding elements in minimum and maximum.
        Parameters:
        v - The input vector
        minimum - The vector containing the minimum acceptable values
        maximum - The vector containing the maximum acceptable values
        Returns:
        (min(max(v.x, minimum.x), maximum.x), min(max(v.y, minimum.y), maximum.y))
        Since:
        5.0.0

        public static VectorI2L clampMaximum(VectorReadable2LType v,

        Clamp the elements of the vector v to the range [-Infinity .. maximum] inclusive.
        Parameters:
        v - The input vector
        maximum - The maximum allowed value
        Returns:
        A vector with both elements equal to at most maximum
        Since:
        5.0.0

      • interpolateLinear

        public static VectorI2L interpolateLinear(VectorReadable2LType v0,
                                          VectorReadable2LType v1,
                                          double alpha)
                                   throws ArithmeticException
        Linearly interpolate between v0 and v1 by the amount alpha. The alpha parameter controls the degree of interpolation, such that:
        • interpolateLinear(v0, v1, 0.0, r) -> r = v0
        • interpolateLinear(v0, v1, 1.0, r) -> r = v1
        Parameters:
        v0 - The left input vector.
        v1 - The right input vector.
        alpha - The interpolation value, between 0.0 and 1.0.
        Returns:
        (1 - alpha) * v0 + alpha * v1
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException - Iff an internal arithmetic operation causes an integer overflow.
        Since:
        5.0.0

      • magnitude

        public static long magnitude(VectorReadable2LType v)
                      throws ArithmeticException
        Calculate the magnitude of the vector v. Correspondingly, magnitude(normalize(v)) == 1.0.
        Parameters:
        v - The input vector
        Returns:
        The magnitude of the input vector
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException - Iff an internal arithmetic operation causes an integer overflow
        Since:
        5.0.0

      • magnitudeSquared

        public static long magnitudeSquared(VectorReadable2LType v)
                             throws ArithmeticException
        Calculate the squared magnitude of the vector v.
        Parameters:
        v - The input vector
        Returns:
        The squared magnitude of the input vector
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException - Iff an internal arithmetic operation causes an integer overflow
        Since:
        5.0.0

      • projection

        public static VectorI2L projection(VectorReadable2LType p,
                                   VectorReadable2LType q)
                            throws ArithmeticException
        Calculate the projection of the vector p onto the vector q.
        Parameters:
        p - The left vector
        q - The right vector
        Returns:
        ((dotProduct p q) / magnitudeSquared q) * q
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException - Iff an internal arithmetic operation causes an integer overflow
        Since:
        5.0.0

      • scale

        public static VectorI2L scale(VectorReadable2LType v,
                              double r)
                       throws ArithmeticException
        Scale the vector v by the scalar r.
        Parameters:
        v - The input vector
        r - The scaling value
        Returns:
        (v.x * r, v.y * r)
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException - Iff an internal arithmetic operation causes an integer overflow

        Subtract the vector v1 from the vector v0.
        Parameters:
        v0 - The left input vector
        v1 - The right input vector
        Returns:
